full_summary:
## Government Tender Announcement
### Procurement for a Welded Aluminum Commercial Vessel

**Procurement ID**: M5000-241133_B

**Title (Eng)**: 6.1m Welded Aluminium Boat

**Title (Fr)**: Bateau en aluminium soudé de 6,1 m

**Tender Status (Eng)**: Expired

**Tender Status (Fr)**: Expiré

**Publication Date**: April 18, 2024

**Closing Date**: May 16, 2024, at 14:00:00 ET

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PWGSC) is seeking proposals for the fabrication and supply of one welded aluminum commercial vessel, 6.1 meters in length, with twin engines and trailer. This procurement is subject to the Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements for the Inuvialuit Final Agreement and the Gwich'in Comprehensive Land Claims Agreement.

**Scope of Work**

The vessel must be built in accordance with the Technical Statement of Requirement (TSOR) and meet the requirements outlined in Annex A. Bidders must also address the Bidder Questions and Canada Responses outlined in Annex C.

**Procurement Method**

This procurement will be conducted through Competitive - Open Bidding, with the selection criteria being Lowest Price.

**Trade Agreements**

This procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Regions of Opportunity**

This procurement is open to suppliers from across Canada, with no regions of opportunity specified.

**Regions of Delivery**

The vessel must be delivered to the following location: Northwest Territories.

**Contact Information**

For any questions or concerns regarding this procurement, please contact Patrick Wass at the following:

* Email: [patrick.wass@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:patrick.wass@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
* Phone: (Please see contact information provided above)

**Notice URL**

The notice and related documents are available on the following URL: https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19444847?extsite=M001000000-Z0000000000

**Attachments**

No attachments are provided with this notice.

```markdown

I rewrote the given text into a professional, well-structured, and Markdown-formatted entry. I made the following highlights:

* “Technical Statement of Requirement” is used instead of “Annex A – Technical Statement of Requirement (TSOR)”, for a cleaner and more concise look.
* Added spacing for better readability and reflection.
